title: Judge saves the CFPB, for now
snippets: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction preventing the Trump administration and its Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) pending the outcome of an ongoing court case.
summary: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction that stops the Trump administration and its Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) while a court case is ongoing.

title: Windows 11 is closing a loophole that let you skip making a Microsoft account
snippets: Microsoft has announced that in the latest Windows 11 Insider Preview, it will remove a bypass script that previously allowed users to set up Windows 11 devices without an internet connection and logging in. This change enforces the requirement for all Windows 11 devices to be connected to the internet and logged into an account during setup.
summary: Microsoft will update Windows 11 Insider Preview, removing a script that permitted offline setup. Now, setting up Windows 11 devices requires an internet connection and account login.

title: The 30 best Amazon Big Spring Sale deals under $30
snippets: Amazon's Big Spring Sale is ongoing until March 31st, offering numerous deals accessible without an Amazon Prime membership. The main roundup includes over 100 deals on popular gear, while another post highlights affordable options.
summary: Amazon's Big Spring Sale, running until March 31st, features over 100 deals on popular items, accessible to all customers without requiring an Amazon Prime membership. The sale also includes a selection of affordable options highlighted in a separate post.

title: Elon Musk’s xAI buys Elon Musk’s X for $33 billion on paper
snippets: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has acquired the social media platform X (previously Twitter) in an all-stock deal. Musk valued xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, which includes $12 billion of debt. This acquisition comes years after Musk originally bought Twitter for $44 billion.
summary: Elon Musk's AI firm, xAI, has bought the social media platform X (formerly Twitter) in an all-stock transaction, valuing xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, including $12 billion in debt. This follows Musk's initial purchase of Twitter for $44 billion years earlier.

title: Microsoft tests Quick Machine Recovery to restore PCs that can’t boot
snippets: Microsoft has initiated testing for Quick Machine Recovery in its latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653). This feature, aimed at IT professionals, enables remote recovery of Windows 11 devices that are unable to boot. It was first announced last year to prevent incidents similar to the Crowdstrike catastrophe.
summary: Microsoft has begun testing Quick Machine Recovery in the latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653) for Windows 11. This feature, designed for IT professionals, allows for the remote recovery of devices that cannot boot. It was introduced following the Crowdstrike incident last year, aiming to enhance system resilience.

title: The Fitbit-to-Google account migration deadline moves to 2026
snippets: Google has extended the deadline for Fitbit users to migrate their accounts to a Google account until next year, following its acquisition of Fitbit in early 2021. Initially, users were required to make the switch by 2025, but a recent email to Fitbit customers announced the extension.
summary: Google has postponed the deadline for Fitbit users to transfer their accounts to Google accounts to next year. This decision comes after Google's acquisition of Fitbit in early 2021. Initially, the migration was mandatory by 2025, but a new announcement via email to Fitbit customers has extended this timeline.
